abstract: Israeli government submits formal plans to build a new neighborhood of Jewish housing in a part of Jerusalem beyond the 1967 lines, on the southern flank of the area projected as the capital of a future state of Palestine; chief Palestinian Authority negotiator Saeb Erekat says that move proves the Israeli government's intent to destroy the peace process and a two-state solution.
snippet: The neighborhood in East Jerusalem is on the southern flank of the area projected as the capital of a future state of Palestine.
lead_paragraph: The neighborhood in East Jerusalem is on the southern flank of the area projected as the capital of a future state of Palestine.

headline.main: Israel Plans to Build More Housing in East Jerusalem
headline.print_headline: Israel Plans to Build More Housing in East Jerusalem
headline.seo: Israel Plans New Housing in East Jerusalem
